Course Section Definition Public Notes: At the moment the course is full. We will be monitoring the wait listed students from now until the start of Term 2, to ensure students requiring this class in either 3rd or 4th year will be registered.
REGISTRATION REQUIRES DEPARTMENTAL APPROVAL. INTERESTED STUDENTS SHOULD CONTACT THE DEPARTMENTAL ADVISOR IN ORDER TO REGISTER.

PHYS and ASTR MAJOR students who are interested in taking this course are required to have the appropriate prerequisites and at least 65% in PHYS 304. Please contact the Undergraduate Program Coordinator to discuss registration in this course.

PHYS and ASTR MAJOR students who are interested in taking this course, have the appropriate prerequisites and at least a 75% average on their physics and math courses, please contact the Undergraduate Program Coordinator to discuss registration in this course.

Course Section: POLI_V 405-E_001 - Advanced Topics in Canadian Politics (E)
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
We are currently facing an unexpected seat shortage in our 400-level POLI seminars and are actively working to find seminar options for POLI Majors, Combined Majors, and Honours students who plan to graduate in May 2025. If you are in this affected group but have not been able to register for a seminar or need additional information about the 2024W seminar seat allocation process, please review this recent announcement from our advising team on our Undergraduate Info Hub. (Current POLI students should be able to access the Info Hub via their Canvas homepage. If you don't have access to the Info Hub, you can enroll here.)
For more detailed information about courses, including descriptions and instructor profiles, visit the POLI course app at: https://poli-2024w-courses.glide.page.
